ygData.subject: Re: Looking for item
ygData.msgSnippet: I tested about every food I could. There seemed to be no change in eating duration from muffins to Iron Rations Foraged Veggies to Fish Fillets I also saw no
ygData.messageBody:
I tested about every food I could.
There seemed to be no change in eating duration from muffins to Iron
Rations
Foraged Veggies to Fish Fillets

I also saw no stat changes like you see drinking ale
There may be some healing capabilites as my test subject was just
standing. Potentially heal faster but I'n my experience running around
with veggie soup and fish fillets I saw no special extras

Samiba Craftsman

--- kale usi <kaleusi@...> wrote:
> From: kale usi <kaleusi@...>
>
>
>
>
> >From: Brendan Daly <samidaly@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ_Potters@onelist.com
> >To: EQ_Potters@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_Potters] Looking for item
> >Date: Wed, 16 Jun 1999 08:58:08 -0700 (PDT)
> >
> >From: Brendan Daly <samidaly@...>
> >
> >If all you want to do is a trade to make money,
> pottery is not the one.
> > Usually there is some item that is missing from
> an area, sketches of
> >firing sheets.
> >
> >Baking is a good one, up to 30 plat an hour around
> Rivervale
> >Brewing also nets around 30 plat an hour in West
> freeport with the
> >benefit of never having to zone
> >
> >The other thing is you don't have to find
> customers, which for Smithing
> >are VERY scarce these days
> >
> >Samiba Craftsman
> >Master Smith, Fletch, Brewer
> >VGood Chef, Good Potter
>
> Was wondering what some of the baked items
> properties are (I hear that some
> do different things like speed up healing) and also
> what the benefits are of
> pottery? I'm looking to make some profit, but I'm
> not looking to make huge
> amounts in mere seconds (I'm more than willing to
> work at earning whatever I
> can get).
>
